verses.esv:
20   Listen to advice and accept instruction,
    that you may gain wisdom in the future.
verses.kjv: 20 Hear counsel, and receive instruction, that thou mayest be wise in thy latter end.
verses.niv: 20 Listen to advice and accept instruction, and in the end you will be wise.

verses.esv:
14   Where there is no guidance, a people falls,
    but in an abundance of counselors there is safety.
verses.kjv: 14 Where no counsel is, the people fall: but in the multitude of counsellors there is safety.
verses.niv: 14 For lack of guidance a nation falls, but many advisers make victory sure.

verses.esv:
15   The way of a fool is right in his own eyes,
    but a wise man listens to advice.
verses.kjv: 15 The way of a fool is right in his own eyes: but he that hearkeneth unto counsel is wise.
verses.niv: 15 The way of a fool seems right to him, but a wise man listens to advice.

verses.esv:
6   for by wise guidance you can wage your war,
    and in abundance of counselors there is victory.
verses.kjv: 6 For by wise counsel thou shalt make thy war: and in multitude of counsellors there is safety.
verses.niv: 6 for waging war you need guidance, and for victory many advisers.

verses.esv:
5   Trust in the LORD with all your heart,
    and do not lean on your own understanding.
6   In all your ways acknowledge him,
    and he will make straight your paths.
verses.kjv: 5 Trust in the LORD with all thine heart; and lean not unto thine own understanding. 6 In all thy ways acknowledge him, and he shall direct thy paths.
verses.niv: 5 Trust in the LORD with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding; 6 in all your ways acknowledge him, and he will make your paths straight.

verses.esv: 29 Let no corrupting talk come out of your mouths, but only such as is good for building up, as fits the occasion, that it may give grace to those who hear.
verses.kjv: 29 Let no corrupt communication proceed out of your mouth, but that which is good to the use of edifying, that it may minister grace unto the hearers.
verses.niv: 29 Do not let any unwholesome talk come out of your mouths, but only what is helpful for building others up according to their needs, that it may benefit those who listen.

verses.esv:
15   The simple believes everything,
    but the prudent gives thought to his steps.
verses.kjv: 15 The simple believeth every word: but the prudent man looketh well to his going.
verses.niv: 15 A simple man believes anything, but a prudent man gives thought to his steps.

verses.esv: 6 Then King Rehoboam took counsel with the old men, who had stood before Solomon his father while he was yet alive, saying, “How do you advise me to answer this people?” 7 And they said to him, “If you will be a servant to this people today and serve them, and speak good words to them when you answer them, then they will be your servants forever.” 8 But he abandoned the counsel that the old men gave him and took counsel with the young men who had grown up with him and stood before him.
verses.kjv: 6 And king Rehoboam consulted with the old men, that stood before Solomon his father while he yet lived, and said, How do ye advise that I may answer this people? 7 And they spake unto him, saying, If thou wilt be a servant unto this people this day, and wilt serve them, and answer them, and speak good words to them, then they will be thy servants for ever. 8 But he forsook the counsel of the old men, which they had given him, and consulted with the young men that were grown up with him, and which stood before him:
verses.niv: 6 Then King Rehoboam consulted the elders who had served his father Solomon during his lifetime. "How would you advise me to answer these people?" he asked. 7 They replied, "If today you will be a servant to these people and serve them and give them a favorable answer, they will always be your servants." 8 But Rehoboam rejected the advice the elders gave him and consulted the young men who had grown up with him and were serving him.

verses.esv:
7   The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge;
    fools despise wisdom and instruction.
verses.kjv: 7 The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge: but fools despise wisdom and instruction.
verses.niv: 7 The fear of the Lord is the beginning of knowledge, but fools despise wisdom and discipline.

verses.esv: 4 Fathers, do not provoke your children to anger, but bring them up in the discipline and instruction of the Lord.
verses.kjv: 4 And, ye fathers, provoke not your children to wrath: but bring them up in the nurture and admonition of the Lord.
verses.niv: 4 Fathers, do not exasperate your children; instead, bring them up in the training and instruction of the Lord.

verses.esv:
10   By insolence comes nothing but strife,
    but with those who take advice is wisdom.
verses.kjv: 10 Only by pride cometh contention: but with the well advised is wisdom.
verses.niv: 10 Pride only breeds quarrels, but wisdom is found in those who take advice.

verses.esv: 13 Better was a poor and wise youth than an old and foolish king who no longer knew how to take advice.
verses.kjv: 13 Better is a poor and a wise child than an old and foolish king, who will no more be admonished.
verses.niv: 13 Better a poor but wise youth than an old but foolish king who no longer knows how to take warning.

verses.esv:
26   Whoever trusts in his own mind is a fool,
    but he who walks in wisdom will be delivered.
verses.kjv: 26 He that trusteth in his own heart is a fool: but whoso walketh wisely, he shall be delivered.
verses.niv: 26 He who trusts in himself is a fool, but he who walks in wisdom is kept safe.

verses.esv:
24   Your testimonies are my delight;
    they are my counselors.
verses.kjv: 24 Thy testimonies also are my delight and my counsellors.
verses.niv: 24 Your statutes are my delight; they are my counselors.

verses.esv:
5   The thoughts of the righteous are just;
    the counsels of the wicked are deceitful.
verses.kjv: 5 The thoughts of the righteous are right: but the counsels of the wicked are deceit.
verses.niv: 5 The plans of the righteous are just, but the advice of the wicked is deceitful.

verses.esv: 9 Two are better than one, because they have a good reward for their toil. 10 For if they fall, one will lift up his fellow. But woe to him who is alone when he falls and has not another to lift him up! 11 Again, if two lie together, they keep warm, but how can one keep warm alone? 12 And though a man might prevail against one who is alone, two will withstand him—a threefold cord is not quickly broken.
verses.kjv: 9 Two are better than one; because they have a good reward for their labour. 10 For if they fall, the one will lift up his fellow: but woe to him that is alone when he falleth; for he hath not another to help him up. 11 Again, if two lie together, then they have heat: but how can one be warm alone? 12 And if one prevail against him, two shall withstand him; and a threefold cord is not quickly broken.
verses.niv: 9 Two are better than one, because they have a good return for their work: 10 If one falls down, his friend can help him up. But pity the man who falls and has no one to help him up! 11 Also, if two lie down together, they will keep warm. But how can one keep warm alone? 12 Though one may be overpowered, two can defend themselves. A cord of three strands is not quickly broken.

verses.esv: 8 Above all, keep loving one another earnestly, since love covers a multitude of sins.
verses.kjv: 8 And above all things have fervent charity among yourselves: for charity shall cover the multitude of sins.
verses.niv: 8 Above all, love each other deeply, because love covers over a multitude of sins.

verses.esv: 5 If any of you lacks wisdom, let him ask God, who gives generously to all without reproach, and it will be given him.
verses.kjv: 5 If any of you lack wisdom, let him ask of God, that giveth to all men liberally, and upbraideth not; and it shall be given him.
verses.niv: 5 If any of you lacks wisdom, he should ask God, who gives generously to all without finding fault, and it will be given to him.

verses.esv: 7 for God gave us a spirit not of fear but of power and love and self-control.
verses.kjv: 7 For God hath not given us the spirit of fear; but of power, and of love, and of a sound mind.
verses.niv: 7 For God did not give us a spirit of timidity, but a spirit of power, of love and of self-discipline.

verses.esv: 28 For which of you, desiring to build a tower, does not first sit down and count the cost, whether he has enough to complete it?
verses.kjv: 28 For which of you, intending to build a tower, sitteth not down first, and counteth the cost, whether he have sufficient to finish it?
verses.niv: 28 "Suppose one of you wants to build a tower. Will he not first sit down and estimate the cost to see if he has enough money to complete it?

verses.esv: 24 And let us consider how to stir up one another to love and good works, 25 not neglecting to meet together, as is the habit of some, but encouraging one another, and all the more as you see the Day drawing near.
verses.kjv: 24 And let us consider one another to provoke unto love and to good works: 25 Not forsaking the assembling of ourselves together, as the manner of some is; but exhorting one another: and so much the more, as ye see the day approaching.
verses.niv: 24 And let us consider how we may spur one another on toward love and good deeds. 25 Let us not give up meeting together, as some are in the habit of doing, but let us encourage one another--and all the more as you see the Day approaching.

verses.esv:
10   fear not, for I am with you;
    be not dismayed, for I am your God;
  I will strengthen you, I will help you,
    I will uphold you with my righteous right hand.
verses.kjv: 10 Fear thou not; for I am with thee: be not dismayed; for I am thy God: I will strengthen thee; yea, I will help thee; yea, I will uphold thee with the right hand of my righteousness.
verses.niv: 10 So do not fear, for I am with you; do not be dismayed, for I am your God. I will strengthen you and help you; I will uphold you with my righteous right hand.

verses.esv:
20   Whoever walks with the wise becomes wise,
    but the companion of fools will suffer harm.
verses.kjv: 20 He that walketh with wise men shall be wise: but a companion of fools shall be destroyed.
verses.niv: 20 He who walks with the wise grows wise, but a companion of fools suffers harm.

verses.esv: 24 Therefore a man shall leave his father and his mother and hold fast to his wife, and they shall become one flesh.
verses.kjv: 24 Therefore shall a man leave his father and his mother, and shall cleave unto his wife: and they shall be one flesh.
verses.niv: 24 For this reason a man will leave his father and mother and be united to his wife, and they will become one flesh.

verses.esv: 15 Jeremiah said to Zedekiah, “If I tell you, will you not surely put me to death? And if I give you counsel, you will not listen to me.”
verses.kjv: 15 Then Jeremiah said unto Zedekiah, If I declare it unto thee, wilt thou not surely put me to death? and if I give thee counsel, wilt thou not hearken unto me?
verses.niv: 15 Jeremiah said to Zedekiah, "If I give you an answer, will you not kill me? Even if I did give you counsel, you would not listen to me."
